inclusion.criterion: Clinical suspicion of acute uncomplicated appendicitis based on history, physical examination, laboratory findings evaluated by a senior surgeon
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: She is a candidate for laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.

exclusion.criterion: Allergy to contrast material or iodine
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Renal failure, creatinine-value greater than the upper reference value
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Her lab work is remarkable for leukocytosis.

exclusion.criterion: Suspicion of peritonitis and appendiceal perforation
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Computed Tomography of the abdomen with contrast shows the presence of a distended appendix with thickened appendiceal wall without perforation, abscess or gangrene.

exclusion.criterion: Incapability to cooperate and give consent to participate in the study
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 31-year-old woman complaining of abdominal pain. The pain started last night as diffuse abdominal discomfort.
